alert.note: Alert for Blount (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 5:14AM CDT until August 04 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR EASTERN BLOUNT COUNTY... At 514 AM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Blountsville, Oneonta. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oneonta, Springville, Blountsville, Cleveland, Locust Fork, Susan Moore, Allgood, Fairview, Nectar, Rosa, Inland Lake, Highland Lake, Easley, Hendrix, Fowler Spring, Clear Springs, Chamblees Mill and Holly Springs. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
